info.title: VIDcredentials API
info.description: VIDcredentials API supplies all the endpoints for entities that want to issue and verify credential.

tags.name: Authentication Service
tags.description: Manage User and Legal Entities Authentication

post.description: VIDcredentials authentication service for users and legal entities.
Creates a W3C Verifiable Id Credential used for User Authentication

requestBody.description: Type of the credential, issuer and credential content.

post.description: Creates a generic W3C Verifiable Credential

requestBody.description: Type of the credential, issuer and credential content.

post.description: Validates the VC format, signature and checks that the issuers is authorized to issue the given credential.

post.summary: Requests a W3C Verifiable Presentation to the user
post.description: Requests a W3C Verifiable Presentation to the user
Validates the Verifiable Presentation format and the signature.
Creates a credential request, i.e. delegate to VIDcredentials API the creation of a credential available to retrieve later on via email.

requestBody.description: Credential receiver, credential content and, optionally, the request expiration

get.description: Resolves a DID into a DID Document

parameters.name: did

DID transform with question mark.summary: a DID with question mark transform

DID transform with semicolon and singula.summary: a DID with semicolon and singular jwk name

DID transform with semicolon and specifi.summary: a DID with semicolon specific jwk kid

parameters.description: DID with an option to request public key in JWK format

requestBody.description: DiD, StatusList identifier and Credential identifier of the credential to revoke

value.message: EntityDid with did: did:ethr:0x1233.. not found

SessionsRequest.title: Sessions Request
SessionsRequest.description: Request for OAuth 2.0 JWT bearer assertion grant.

grantType.description: OAuth 2.0 grant type. Must be set to "urn:ietf:params:oauth:grant-type:jwt-bearer"

scope.description: Scope is used to define the authentication method.

expiresIn.description: Time in seconds after which the token should not be accepted

LegalEntitiesAttributesRequest.title: Legal Entities Attributes Request
LegalEntitiesAttributesRequest.description: Request to modify Legal Entities Attributes.

accessToken.description: A signed JWT Access Token issued by the vidchain-api to access the API.

tokenType.description: Type of the authentication token. Supported type "bearer".

issuedAt.description: Time of JWT issuance. Format: unix timestamp

id.description: URI that is used to unambiguously refer to an object, such as a person, product, or organization.

@context.description: An ordered set where the first item is a URI https://www.w3.org/2018/credentials/v1. It is used to define terms and help to express specific identifiers in a compact manner.

type.description: Type of the object or the datatype of the typed value.

credentialSubject.description: A set of objects that contain one or more properties that are each related to the subject of the credential.

issuer.description: A URI or an object containing an id property. Example: DID of the verifiable credential/presentation issuer.

oneOf.description: DID of the verifiable credential/presentation issuer.
Object containing an id property to identify the issuer.

id.description: URI that is used to unambiguously refer to an object, such as a person, product, or organization.

issuanceDate.description: Date and time at which the information associated with the verifiable credential/presentation becomes valid.

expirationDate.description: Date and time at which a credential/presentation ceases to be valid.

subject.title: Subject
subject.description: A thing about which claims are made

embeddedProof.title: Embedded Proof
embeddedProof.description: Cryptographic proofs that can be used to detect tampering and verify the authorship of a credential or presentation. An embedded proof is a mechanism where the proof is included in the data, such as a Linked Data Signature.

type.description: Type of the object or the datatype of the typed value.

created.description: Date and time at which proof has been created.

proofPurpose.description: It expresses the purpose of the proof and ensures the information is protected by the signature.

verificationMethod.description: Specifies the public key that can be used to verify the digital signature. Dereferencing a public key URL reveals information about the controller of the key, which can be checked against the issuer of the credential.

id.description: DID subject of an existing User
DID subject is the entity identified by the DID

@context.description: The @context property ensures that two systems operating on the same DID document are using mutually agreed terminology. It can be one or more URIs.

type.description: Type determine whether or not a provided verifiable credential or verifiable presentation is appropriate. It mus be one or more URIs.

credentialSubject.description: W3C Verifiable Credential content. It is a set of objects that contain one or more properties that are each related to a subject of the verifiable credential.

issuer.description: Issuer of the verifiable credential.It can be either a URI or an object containing an id property.

issuanceDate.description: Date and time when a credential becomes valid.

expirationDate.description: Date and time the credential ceases to be valid.

credentialStatus.description: Discovery of information about the current status of a verifiable credential

id.description: URL to discover the current status of the credential

type.description: Credential status type also referred to as the credential status method. It provides information to determine the current status of the credential.

id.description:
URI that is used to unambiguously refer to an object, such as a person, product, or
organization.

@context.description:
An ordered set where the first item is a URI https://www.w3.org/2018/credentials/v1. It
is used to define terms and help to express specific identifiers in a compact manner.

type.description: Type of the object or the datatype of the typed value.

verifiableCredential.description:
VerifiableCredential is composed of one or more verifiable credentials, or of data
derived from verifiable credentials in a cryptographically verifiable format.

oneOf.description: Data derived from verifiable credentials in a cryptographically verifiable format.

holder.description: URI of the entity that is generating the presentation.

verifiablePresRequest.title: Verifiable Presentation Request
verifiablePresRequest.description: Request for a Verifiable Presentation with designated Verifiable Credentials

target.description: DID from the user to request the VP

type.description: list of Verifiable Credentials types array

items.description: Type of the object or the datatype of the typed value.

callResponse.title: Response from a VIDchain API call
callResponse.description: Response from a VIDchain API call

@context.description:
An URI https://w3id.org/did/v1 to
define terms and help to express specific identifiers in a compact manner.

id.description: The DID subject is the entity that the DID document is about

controller.description:
Its value expresses one or more DIDs. Any verification methods contained in the DID Documents
for those DIDs SHOULD be accepted as authoritative, such that proofs that satisfy those
verification methods are to be considered equivalent to proofs provided by the DID Subject.

authentication.description:
If present, the associated value MUST be an ordered set of one or more verification methods.
Each verification method MAY be embedded or referenced.

verificationMethod.description:
The value of the property MUST be an ordered set of verification methods, where each verification
method is described by a map containing properties. The properties MUST include the id, type,
controller, and specific verification method properties, and MAY include additional properties.

type.description:
The value of the type property MUST be exactly one verification method type. In order to
maximize global interoperability, the verification method type SHOULD be registered in the
[DID-SPEC-REGISTRIES].

id.description: The DID subject is the entity that the DID document is about

controller.description:
Its value expresses one or more DIDs. Any verification methods contained in the DID Documents
for those DIDs SHOULD be accepted as authoritative, such that proofs that satisfy those
verification methods are to be considered equivalent to proofs provided by the DID Subject.

type.description:
The value of the type property MUST be exactly one verification method type. In order to
maximize global interoperability, the verification method type SHOULD be registered in the
[DID-SPEC-REGISTRIES].

publicKeyBase58.description: Hexadecimal public key encoded in base58.

publicKeyJwk.description: Public key value encoded as a JWK [RFC7517]
Public key value encoded as a JWK
publicKeyJwk.title: Public Key JWK Data Model

type.description:
An absolute URI that identifies the problem type. When dereferenced,
it SHOULD provide human-readable documentation for the problem type.

title.description: A short summary of the problem type.

status.description: The HTTP status code generated by the origin server for this occurrence of the problem.

detail.description: A human readable explanation specific to this occurrence of the problem.

instance.description:
An absolute URI that identifies the specific occurrence of the problem.
It may or may not yield further information if dereferenced.

credentialRequestUserToken.title: Credential Request User Token

email.description: Email of the user who eagers to get the credential

payload.description: Data to include in the credential

expiresIn.description: Expiration time of the request in seconds (24h by default)

UserSessionRequest.description: In case of **User Session Request**, the assertion has to be a **JWT token** signed with User's DID private key

value.title: Forbidden
